comment: She is very willing to help you if you talk to her. Class was straightforward and she did a great job getting what you need to know across.

At the start of the semester I wasn't sure that Psychology had anything to do with my major or what I cared about. Dr. Gottstein is firm about rules like no extra credit and no late submissions. She is very responsive to emails and might extend a deadline if you give her a good reason. She sometimes hints at test material in class which is helpful.

She was nice, and responded to emails quickly, however she gives no sort of study guide or clear guidance on what to expect on the tests. Most of the tests covered 4 chapters, which each had several units, so a lot of studying is needed. Tests are lockdown browser, camera on. I would not take another course with this professor personally.

A hard class but she made it easier in my opinion, her lectures are good summaries of the textbook readings the only thing I was not a huge fan of was the weekly activities on learning curve but I really did enjoy her class and got alot out of it learning wise. If you have to take HD take her!!

Dr. Gottstein really enjoys interacting with students, which makes the class much more engaging and fun. Assignments are usually due on Fridays and Sundays. There isn't much writing involved; most of the work is quiz-style assignments. She responds to emails and questions really quickly. Attendance is checked randomly during class.

Structured work load with similar assignments due for each chapter at the same time weekly. Highly responsive to emails and questions, even on weekends. There is a policy for no late work and no extra credit, but she's willing to discuss this if needed. I had an unexpected illness which impacted my timeliness and she was willing to work with me.

Please avoid this professor. I took her for an online class, and it was time-consuming and confusing. The material itself isn't confusing, but she makes the class much harder than it needs to be. She doesn't put clear instructions on the assignment and says it's your fault. She also won't tell you what to study for exams, so you're on your own.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework
